channel.title: Client port null
channel.description:
Hi guys, I finished making my 317 delta with customs client webclient ready.
Before jarring (non jarred form) the client works fine. This is it's normal statistics: User:____ Password:_____ Server IP:127.0.0.1 Port: 43594
Now after being jarred, it says this: User:____ Password:____ Server IP:127.0.0.1 Port: null
If you didn't noticed, port is marked 'null'
That's the whole problem, I've tried a lot of things but none can get it to go port 43594 in jarred form. And I can't connect from 127.0.0.1 or from my no-ip ip. Any suggestions

item.title: Client port null
item.dc:creator: @devilishomar devilishomar
item.description:
@devilishomar wrote:

Still need help guys

Read full topic

item.title: Client port null
item.dc:creator: @The_Outsider The Outsider
item.description:
@The_Outsider wrote:

Well, no one else was commenting so just checking.

Here’s someone else with a null problem using .jar. Maybe you can read through it and find some hints? http://www.codeguru.com/forum/archive/index.php/t-305695.html

Read full topic

item.title: Client port null
item.dc:creator: @devilishomar devilishomar
item.description:
@devilishomar wrote:

No that’s no good ;( It’s already ‘final’. Thanks anyway

Read full topic

item.title: Client port null
item.dc:creator: @The_Outsider The Outsider
item.description:
@The_Outsider wrote:

I was thinking along the lines of declaring the port somewhere (manifest, Run.bat if you have one etc.). If it’s nulled then the port is no where, it’s not even the value “nothing”, it is literally pointing no where, so try and think what could be making it do that.

If you already knew that then please realise I was just trying to enlighten you, as I don’t know what could be causing it my self (try changing int port to final int port). That might keep it static…

Read full topic

item.title: Client port null
item.dc:creator: @devilishomar devilishomar
item.description:
@devilishomar wrote:

If you mean adding the word ‘client’ in the ‘set manifest’ part, then yes.

Read full topic

item.description:
@devilishomar wrote:

Hi guys, I finished making my 317 delta with customs client webclient ready.

Before jarring (non jarred form) the client works fine.
This is it’s normal statistics:
User:____
Password:_____
Server IP:127.0.0.1
Port: 43594

Now after being jarred, it says this:
User:____
Password:____
Server IP:127.0.0.1
Port: null

If you didn’t noticed, port is marked ‘null’

That’s the whole problem, I’ve tried a lot of things but none can get it to go port 43594 in jarred form. And I can’t connect from 127.0.0.1 or from my no-ip ip. Any suggestions
